Name: Shell bracelet
Description: Plain shell bracelet, from the excavations of John Garstang in 1906. Shell and bone ornaments were more common in Egypt in the Predynastic Periods. In the late Middle Kingdom and 2nd Intermediate Period (about 1850-1550 BC) they are found again in cemeteries within Egypt, in burials of south-eastern desert nomads used as security men by the Egyptians.
